tool.name: Assess CMR Regions Quality
tool.command:
ln -sf $bedFile $bedFile'.bed'; #import json #import os
#set $ipBamFile = list() #set $inputBamFile = list() #for $fileone in $bamFiles: ln -sf $fileone.BAMIP $fileone.BAMIP'.bam'; ln -sf $fileone.BAMinput $fileone.BAMinput'.bam'; $ipBamFile.append(str($fileone.BAMIP)+'.bam') $inputBamFile.append(str($fileone.BAMinput)+'.bam') #end for #set ipBamFile=",".join(ipBamFile) #set inputBamFile=",".join(inputBamFile) Rscript ${__tool_directory__}/02_Assess_CMR_Regions_Quality.R $bedFile".bed" #echo json.dumps(ipBamFile)# #echo json.dumps(inputBamFile)# $output $minOverlap $type;

param.name: bedFile
param.label: Input CMR regions in BED format

param.name: type
param.label: Select a measure?
param.option: raw read count for interval using only reads from IP
raw read count for interval from IP divided by read count for interval from control
raw read count for interval from IP minus read count for interval from control
RPKM for interval using only reads from IP
RPKM for interval from IP divided by RPKM for interval from control
TMM normalized (using edgeR), using IP read counts and Full Library size
TMM normalized (using edgeR), using IP read counts and Effective Library size
TMM normalized (using edgeR), using IP read counts minus Control read counts and Full Library size
TMM normalized (using edgeR), using IP read counts minus Control read counts and Effective Library size
same as DBA_SCORE_TMM_READS_FULL, but reported in counts-per-million.
same as DBA_SCORE_TMM_READS_EFFECTIVE, but reported in counts-per-million
same as DBA_SCORE_TMM_MINUS_FULL, but reported in counts-per-million
same as DBA_SCORE_TMM_MINUS_EFFECTIVE, but reported in counts-per-million
summit height (maximum read pileup value), normalized to relative library size
summit position (location of maximum read pileup)

param.name: minOverlap
param.label: Only include peaks in at least this many peaksets when generating consensus peakset

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool aims to quantify CMR signal strength by counting reads and calculating RPKM in binding site intervals using an R package Diffbind (Wu *et al*., 2016, *Frontiers in Genetics*)
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
- **CMR regions in BED format** - **IP alignments in BAM format** - **input alignments in BAM format**
.. class:: infomark
**Parameters**
- **select a measure:** select a method for quantify CMR regions. - If biological replications exist, users can specify **only include peaks in at least *N* peaksets when generating consensus peakset**, the defaults is 1.
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
- A tab seperated matrix recording the quantification for each CMR region.
